_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Vertex Chemical Corporation uses batch manufacturing to manufacture sodium hypochlorite using chlorine, sodium hydroxide and water. This facility started batch manufacturing at the Camanche, IA location in 1989.    



The Camanche facility is sited distant from residential population, in an industrial area with space, fences, security, natural obstacles separating the areas from casual public.  A perimeter fence with guard service is located around the facility to keep the public out.  Vertex shares security and perimeter fencing with another manufacturing company, Clysar.  Secondary security fencing is located around the chlorine railcar unloading area to keep unauthorized personnel away from the chlorine unloading area.  Batch process is set up as close as possible to the chlorine railcars to reduce pipeline distance which reduces the hazard of mechanical failure and how much chlorine would be released in a pipeline failure.



Prevention and Emergency Response policies:  Hawkins' management and safety committees have set a motto of "Think Safe! Be Safe!" regarding accidents and injuries.  Support for this motto is manifested in several ways, including:

1. A corporate Health, Safety and Environmental (HSE) department staffed with trained professionals.

2. Training programs in chemical safety, safe material handling, accident prevention and emergency response.

3. Prompt investigation of near misses and incidents to identify root causes and implement measures to prevent future occurrences.

4. Adherence to all EPA and OSHA regulations governing our operations.

5. Compliance with DOT requirements regarding shipping and materials.

6. Internal and 3rd party audits of Health, Safety and Environmental procedures at all Hawkins locations.

7. Members in good standing with the Chlorine Institute and the National Association of Chemical Distributors.



Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled:  This facility is a chemical distribution and manufacturing faci

ee and hazardous materials responders (Clinton County Special Emergency Association) and the Camanche Local Volunteer Fire Department to ensure everyone is aware of the hazards at this site.



Planned Changes:  While Hawkins desires to continually improve safety, there are no specific changes planned other than to continue compliance with industry standards and government regulations and our own commitment to "Think Safe! Be Safe!"
